website_summaries.verdict: Whether you work from home, in a small office, or with varied home printing, scanning, faxing, and copying needs, this all-in-one takes care of business.
pros: Makes excellent photo and text prints
cons: forces ink-swapping between text and photo printing

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: This printer features the 'mirror image copy' feature that has been discontinued in later models. Great for Iron-on transfer printing!
customer_reviews.author: jayessell

customer_reviews.title: The best HP I ever had
customer_reviews.text: This printer is the best, I installed in about 35 min. wireless conection with my router and was very easy, you just have to follow the instructions and thas all. The wireless print speed is very good, the scanner software is something weak, but I use another program to scan. The photo print is very good, better than my loyal HP 970, is not perfect, but is really nice. I recomend this printer for many users at home or office.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Herrador

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a good printer but all the features were not working when received. I wish they had not discontinued it. ?
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Strowd

customer_reviews.title: Good all in one printer
customer_reviews.text: It's a great printer--prints fast and quality is pretty good. It's very convenient to have all the different media storage slots right on the machine itself for easy downloads of pictures. However, I was missing a USB cable when I received it and customer service at HP was not the easiest to navigate to have it replaced without getting charged.
customer_reviews.author: Oneproudmama

customer_reviews.title: Good wireless network printer.
customer_reviews.text: This printer replaced my Canon Mp730 printer to be used as a wireless network printer for our 3 laptops. Network setup was easy and works great in this area; however, I felt as I took a downgrade from my previous printer. Software is bloated and causes all type of problems, even with all three being HP laptops, tech support is not much of help and no auto document feeder for fax or scanning. Regular text print quality is great, and photo quality is great as long as you don't use the HP papers, Canon or Epson papers highly recommended. Overall, I'm happy with using it as a network printer and have learned to live with other shortcomings.
customer_reviews.author: inlvnv

customer_reviews.title: pretty good, with exceptions
customer_reviews.text: I've had my printer for 5 months now. I find it to be a great piece of equipment. I only have two exceptions: 1. No feeder tray. The printer does not have a feeder tray for multi-page faxes or copies. You must load one sheet at a time on the flatbed screen. 2. I just recently ran through 5 color cartridges in an attempt to print 150 color copies. The kicker is that my document's main color was green. So, when that ran out, I had to replace the entire cartridge. That was pretty irritating to me.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. McGee

customer_reviews.title: NEVER A SOFTWARE UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from this careless company's products. The machine may function well, but HP does not provide any software updates for its products. As a consequence, my 2710 no longer operates in the Windows XP environment, although it worked in this environment when I paid money for it. Technical support told me "We are very aware of this problem and are working on it." That's nice, but I cannot use the scan functions at all from the PC, nor will you be able to.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Oliphant

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I ever owned and 366 days later it died
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Networkedbeautifully (even with our macs), GREAT clear prints,loved the all in one functionality. CON: 366 days after I purchased this printer the scanning mechanism broke and scanning and copying features ceased. The folks at HP offered me 15% coupon towards the purchase of a new printer, but little else in the line of help. The scanner was used less than 50 times over the life of the product. I have heard from a number of people in stores that these printers are notorious for this problem. Bottom line, if you have the funds to replace annually this is a great printer, otherwise I would recommend looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: nunyabiznezz

customer_reviews.title: Is this seller kidding? It only had full functionality ...
customer_reviews.text: Is this seller kidding? It only had full functionality in Windows XP which is an operating system no longer supported by Microsoft. It doesnt have E Print capability. Also this model is notorious for scanner failure errors. I wouldn't spend a dime on this model which originally came out in 2005. I couldn't put 1/2 star in the rating. Please shop elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Mikesell

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have the HP 2710, I've had it for quite some time. I've never had a moment's problem with it. I love the wireless aspect, my printer sits about 40 feet from my PC in a whole other room! I never have any issues with it, it ihas been reliabe, I use it daily, easy to change the cartridges, easy set up, I have two PC's and a notebook connected to it. I'd say buy it! I know I've had mine at least 4 years......
customer_reviews.author: M. Merriken

customer_reviews.title: Save your money - buy a different printer!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is very disappointing, mostly due to the very flawed software. Installation was horrific, crashed my computer a few times. Had to totally disable Norton Anti-Virus and Internet Security during the installation. Scarry...Doesn't seem to matter if printer is connected wirelessly or to a hub/router, doesn't function properly either way. Printing is ok, but forget about scanning. I can't even scan from the scanner itself even though the printer finds the network. After uninstalling and reinstalling the drivers and many calls to tech support, still doesn't work. I don't see why anyone should purchase this printer. It prints decently but is severely flawed as an all-in-one solution.
customer_reviews.author: Scrabble Freak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer - Install Carefully
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 2710 about a month ago. Installed easily (wired network), works beautifully. Photos look great even without special photo cartridge! Only recently tried to use scanner and found that it did not work. Other system prolems were also apparent. After lengthy investigation with tech support, we determined that problem was interference from McAfee during install (although I had 'disabled' it). Uninstalled Mcafee, reinstalled software; now works perfectly. An excellent product! I just wish tech support was in the US (got a follow-up call from them at 1:00 am this morning!).
customer_reviews.author: Frank Newman

customer_reviews.title: Died 1 month after warranty, also toner dries up quickly
customer_reviews.text: This printer was about $500 when I got it a year ago. The first one died and I got a replacement. This one eats photo paper. Also, the toner only works fresh out of the bag. Leave it for a couple of days and it dries up. You can use a q-tip to clean it, but the photos come out with lines on them. I can't afford to keep wasting money on photo paper and toner. What a bad purchase. Shame on HP - I will not buy HP products again.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: hp 2710 multifunction
customer_reviews.text: I rev'd this for a christmas present and used it very little, all of a sudden the carriage quit. I called HP and talked to a man that I couldn't even understand, but basically he told me it wasn't worth fixing buy a new one. So I did I bought a Canon. That will be my last HP. bubblee from KC,KS
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Miller

customer_reviews.title: worked great on old computer
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked great on my old computer with XP windows, was easy to install. However with my new HP computer with windows 7 it will not install. I got it to print but I can't install the software that comes with it. I wonder if it's the windows 7 it is not liking. I don't have the scanning software now, all I can do is print and copy. Anyone have any ideas?
customer_reviews.author: gammy lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great All-in-One
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 2710 despite the nightmare installation stories in these reviews. I'm happy to report I installed it using the wireless option on 3 PCs and 1 Mac on my network without a single issue. It only took 15 minutes to do the minimal install which is all I believe you need. I'm very impressed with how well this device works and the wireless functionality is great. I recommend doing the minimal software install. You can still scan, fax, print and everything else you just loose HP's photo editing software but I'm betting everyone has their own they like anyway.
customer_reviews.author: G. Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Wireless Printer
customer_reviews.text: After doing some research, I purchased the HP 2710 and I only have one word for it: A W E S O M E. There are 3 connection options - USB, Ethernet or wireless. I chose the latter and it's great. I use both a desktop and notebook computer and I enjoy the convenience and flexibility of being able to print through a wireless connection. I have also used it to make crisp copies, but I have neither used the scanner nor photo printer. I highly recommend ths product.
customer_reviews.author: East Coast Student

customer_reviews.title: Power issues.
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second one, not sure what happens, but I have tested the power coming thru the cord and all is well to the unit. After about six months on both units the display went out and nothing seems to have power anymore. I called HP on the first one and did the swap for 150 dollars, was pleased with that. However, since the same thing happened, now I am looking for a different brand. Thinking Epson this go around
customer_reviews.author: B. Schick

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome with Macintosh
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this printer today and I love it!!! Setup with an existing 802.11b network (Linksys) and my Macintosh was seamless. Total setup time was less than 20 minutes, including installing software. I was able to scan immediately, print photos from iPhoto and a memory stick and print regular documents wirelessly right after setup. Looking forward using all the features. The interface on the printer is easy to use and the integration with Mac OS X is fluid. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: George E. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Major software issues
customer_reviews.text: After installing and uninstalling the software and patches ad nauseum, I cannot get rid of the DEP error on my screen. Tech support is terrible and told me my operating system is corrupt and to reload it. On Google, if you search on Photosmart and DEP, there are 36,000 hits discussing this issue. I will never buy another HP product in my lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: PCS

customer_reviews.title: Great all-in-one wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer installed as documented and has worked flawlessly ever since. I have multiple laptops, even PDA's printing to the 2710 and the response time is as immediate as a direct-connect printer. Faxing, scanning, and copying also work nicely, but the beauty of having a fast wireless printer that was a breeze to hook-up makes this printer my pick.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Lynksis wireless network and I got this printer up and running in less than an hour. All my computers see it and can print from it. The print quality is great and I couldn't be more pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joel-O-Mite

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart 2710
customer_reviews.text: I loved this photo printer so when my boss wanted one for her desk this was the first printer that I wanted to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alice F. Watson

customer_reviews.title: This printer is simply garbage!  Stay away from it.
customer_reviews.text: This will be the last time I buy a HP or any HP products. Thier customer service lacks on top of it. This printer is the worst! First of all it has problems with any PC...and its primary function does not even work right. How HP gets away with selling stuff like this is beyond me but they will never get me again. It was fun running over it wih my truck!!!! HP you suck!!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. G.

product_meta.title: HP Photosmart 2710 All-in-One Printer
product_meta.description: HP Photosmart 2710 All-in-One Fax Printer Scanner Copier means Color printing, color faxing, color copying, color scanning with inkjet high quality depth and resolution. Reward your family with its own wireless printing network! Does your daughter or son have a Bluetooth wireless device? Those with camera phones and other gadgets can get into the act, too, printing straight to the Photosmart 2710 no PC, no wires, no hassle. Enhance and organize digital photos Print frame-by-frame from video clips using the proof sheet Pages/month - 5,000 Fax Speed about 3 seconds/page / Incoming fax memory - 60 pages / Fax speed dials - 75 numbers 48-bit Color Flatbed Scanner Connectivity - 1 Ethernet, 1 USB, 1 PictBridge, Built-in wireless 802.11g 802.11b networking For PC and Macintosh
feature_bullets: Produces color prints, copies, scans, and faxes
Up to 30 ppm print speed; up to 4,800 x 1,200 dpi resolution
Up to 30 cpm, reduces and enlarges 25 to 400%
Ethernet, wireless 802.11g/b, USB, PictBridge interfaces; PC/Mac

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars66 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
